txt.en: 'King Thranduil of the Woodland realm and I met in council. We spoke of the northern kingdoms and their peoples: the Elves that walk Felegoth's cavernous halls, the Men of Dale and those who dwell by the Long Lake, and the dwarves that live beneath Erebor, the Lonely Mountain. Much evil and darkness has left those lands, but it has not left them untouched.\n\n'I know you ache for the distant shores, but I ask you to stay in these lands a while longer and do your part to restore peace to the north. Speak with Thranduil in the halls of Felegoth. You can find a swift horse to the lands of the Elvenking by going to the ruins of Ost Galadh in Emyn Lûm, located in Southern Mirkwood. A horse will bear you swiftly to Tham Taerdol, and in the woods to the north-east you will find Felegoth.'
Galadriel can be found either at the Court of Celeborn or in Caras Galadhon.\n\nYou should speak with Galadriel.

'King Thranduil of the Woodland realm and I met in council. We spoke of the northern kingdoms and their peoples: the Elves that walk Felegoth's cavernous halls, the Men of Dale and those who dwell by the Long Lake, and the dwarves that live beneath Erebor, the Lonely Mountain. Much evil and darkness has left those lands, but it has not left them untouched.\n\n'I ask that you do your part to restore peace to the north. Speak with Thranduil in the halls of Felegoth. You can find a swift horse to the lands of the Elvenking by going to the ruins of Ost Galadh in Emyn Lûm, located in Southern Mirkwood. A horse will bear you swiftly to Tham Taerdol, and in the woods to the north-east you will find Felegoth.'
Galadriel can be found either at the Court of Celeborn or in Caras Galadhon.\n\nYou should speak with Galadriel.
For this moment, as we stand beneath the golden leaves, I am merely a messenger.

For this moment, as we stand beneath the golden leaves, I am merely a messenger.
Speak with Galadriel in the Court of Celeborn or in Caras Galadhon.
Introduction: Northern Mirkwood
I have been expecting your arrival.
Speak with King Thranduil in the halls of Felegoth, in Eryn Lasgalen

King Thranduil can be found in Felegoth, in Eryn Lasgalen. A swift horse in Southern Mirkwood will bring you to Tham Taerdol in Eryn Lasgalen, not far from the Elvenking's halls. Find such a swift horse in the ruins of Ost Galadh, in Emyn Lûm.

'There is a question upon your brow. Why have I called for you once more, [placeholder] - for I gave my word to release you from your troth of service? For this moment, as we stand beneath the golden leaves, I am merely a messenger.

'Thranduil, son of Oropher, and king of the Woodland realm met in council, here in Lothlórien. We spoke of the kingdoms of the north - the Elf halls of Felegoth - Dale, the city of Men - The Dwarven caverns of Erebor. While much of the evil and darkness has left these lands, there is still that which does not release its grip.

'It pains me to ask so much of you, however, I can see no one greater in restoring peace to the north. Go and speak with Thranduil. He is expecting you at Felegoth, in Eryn Lasgalen.'
You have been summoned by Galadriel, Lady of Lórien, to discuss matters concerning the kingdoms of the north.\n\nYou should meet Galadriel either at the Court of Celeborn or in Caras Galadhon.
Speak with Galadriel
You have been summoned by Galadriel, Lady of Lórien, to discuss matters concerning the kingdoms of the north.
'Hail, [placeholder]. I have been expecting your arrival.'

'King Thranduil of the Woodland realm and I met in council. We spoke of the northern kingdoms and their peoples: the Elves that walk Felegoth's cavernous halls, the Men of Dale and those who dwell by the Long Lake, and the dwarves that live beneath Erebor, the Lonely Mountain. Much evil and darkness has left those lands, but it has not left them untouched.\n\n'I ask that you do your part to restore peace to the north. Speak with Thranduil in the halls of Felegoth. You can find a swift horse to the lands of the Elvenking by going to the ruins of Ost Galadh in Emyn Lûm, located in Southern Mirkwood. A horse will bear you swiftly to Tham Taerdol, and in the woods to the north-east you will find Felegoth.'

'There is a question upon your brow. Why have I called for you once more, [placeholder] - for I gave my word to release you from your troth of service? For this moment, as we stand beneath the golden leaves, I am merely a messenger.

'Thranduil, son of Oropher, and king of the Woodland realm met in council, here in Lothlórien. We spoke of the kingdoms of the north - the Elf halls of Felegoth - Dale, the city of Men - The Dwarven caverns of Erebor. While much of the evil and darkness has left these lands, there is still that which does not release its grip.

'I know you ache as I do for the distant shores. I must ask of you to stay in these lands a while longer. I can see no one greater in restoring peace to the north. Go and speak with Thranduil. He is expecting you at Felegoth, in Eryn Lasgalen.'
